Articles.Content: String cheese is satisfying because it peels, but its also deeply unsatisfying because it never peels evenly. Bit of a trap that way. Someone should invent a string cheese that peels perfectly every time. I’d pay top dollar.
I am thinking about tomorrow, I have a lot of tasks to do

An up orientation on a helicopter is confusing because roll pushes the tail not the cockpit, there is no alternative unless you flip upside down. Realised that we have been steering rockets as if the are a trackball all this time.

It's so strange to see cyrillic letters on American flags...

Spoiler

You put a massive amount of work into a mod over a month and one you only spent an hour on gets double the downloads in the same length of time.

You upgrade a mod so that it is much better and has new parts and then suddenly the earlier version (which you would have to go into the changelog section to download) gets a sudden spike in downloads.

Human beings are hard to understand.
Yknow, after the third bit of white supremacist propaganda Facebook has served up to me in the last month I think we're done here.
Spoiler

10 hours ago, Pthigrivi said:

Yknow, after the third bit of white supremacist propaganda Facebook has served up to me in the last month I think we're done here. 

Surprised you weren't done with facebook much earlier.

Basically anybody who thinks the pigment in ones skin determines their value is so far behind the world that they aren't worth worrying about. They are as a group being erroded day by day and eventually they will be an oddity that the population thinks of as having a mental abberation and feels sorry for.

Hobbits were named so because they were just a Gandalf's hobby, a farming simulator.

The Tolkien elves (singular = "elf") were Ubermensch of the Middle-Earth, thus tall, blonde, and long-faced (don't look at the Rings of Power amateur cosplay).
Exactly like him, as it was his Sims, in the dollhouse called Middle-Earth.

When Iluvatar had created the elves (it was 11 of them because Iluvatar himself would be the 12th), he counted them speaking his language:
"Eins. Zwei. Drei. ... Ja, ja, gut. Elf.. Und ich bin Zwölf... Zwoelf... Zwo Elf.... Doppel-Elf. Iluvatar, Alles-Vater."

Thus they were called "Das Elf", or in Westron "The Eleven", or just "the Elves".

It was odd. Literally odd. Because couldn't be divided in pairs.
It's the source of their problems.

And the Valar number was odd, too. 7 of he-Valar + 7 of she-Valar + 1 Melkor.
That's why Melkor was so angry. He was the only Vala with no pair.

Once he invited the Chaotic chick, Ungoliant, to be his crush.
They ran a gothic party, 
Because Melkor was a Goth (though other Valar were scornfully calling him Gepid), was wearing black clothes and hairdo, and called himself Moar-Goth, or Morgoth.

Ungoliant dressed appropriately, with a spider-like brooch on hair.

But other Valar ruined their date, drove away Ungie, and kicked them out.

Edited September 19, 2022 by kerbiloid
BTW, for me as a finn, Eru Iluvatar being male (he/him pronouns) is kinda confusing since a tar/tär ending denotes female things... Queen= kuningatar, actress= näyttelijätär...

I feel like I need a P.H.D

What does dolphin cheese taste like?

1 hour ago, Ryaja said:

What does dolphin cheese taste like?

I don't know, but the phrase "dolphin cheese" tastes like vomit.
Depends on fish the dolphin has eaten.

Here's a random very specific thought of mine, what's the chance there exists a person who lives in Oulu (big city in Finland on the coast, and the edge of what is northern Finland and what isn't), loves the color cyan (i do but not the others), is transgender, and has a genetic heritage of 50% inari sami and 50% percent finnish?
I am guessing 1 in roughly 7 billion.
What's the chance that somebody had an idea to build a city on the North coast of Finland and call it Oulu?
I am guessing 1 in roughly 6 billion.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man-of-war

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wellerman

I.e. "ship" = "man"

Then why "ship" is "she / her"?

Apparently Mario’s last name is Mario, making his full name Mario Mario. I don’t know how to feel about that.

1 hour ago, Pthigrivi said:

Apparently Mario’s last name is Mario, making his full name Mario Mario. I don’t know how to feel about that. 

Wait so Luigi's name is Luigi Mario?

So when their mom was mad at Luigi and Yelled "Luigi Mario you come in the house right this minute!" how did Mario know she didn't want him to come in too?

10 minutes ago, Superfluous J said:

Wait so Luigi's name is Luigi Mario?

So when their mom was mad at Luigi and Yelled "Luigi Mario you come in the house right this minute!" how did Mario know she didn't want him to come in too?

So many questions.

They always did that together.

P.S.
If a child has more than two names, do they list all of them every time in such official speech?

Edited September 27, 2022 by kerbiloid
I always thought his name was Mario Gabriele Luigi Bowser Yoshi Andretti the third.

In the ancient and medieval legends, myths, and chronicles, when a person was changing his (every time the only) name, he was kinda reborn as another person, cancelling his previous life and beginning a new one.

It stays incomprehensible for me, how several names at once can not result into split personality.

(Not nicknames, but personal names).

Edited September 27, 2022 by kerbiloid
